    6057             :               severity = strict_ansi_mode ? es_discretionary_error : es_remark;
    6058             :               keep_qualifier = TRUE;
    6059             :             } else if (gpp_mode || sun_mode) {
    6060             :               /* GNU and Sun compilers accept the superfluous qualifier and
    6061             :                  ignore it.  As explained above, we cannot always emulate this
    6062             :                  behavior for templates (unless dependent name processing is
    6063             :                  enabled, which is the default for gnu_version >= 30400). */
    6064             :               severity = es_warning;
    6065             :             }  /* if */
    6066             :           }  /* if */
    6067             :           if (!keep_qualifier) {
    6068             :             /* Reset the fields in the locator to make it appear as if the
    6069             :                qualifier were not present. */
    6070             :             clear_qualifier_from_locator(&locator_for_curr_id);
    6071             :           }  /* if */
    6072             :           if (severity == es_error) {
    6073             :             /* This is not a benign error in a template declaration, so
    6074             :                make this an error locator.  Otherwise, there are name-binding
    6075             :                bugs in this sort of case:
    6076             :                  namespace N {
    6077             :                    template <class T> void N::f(T);
    6078             :                    class N { ... };
    6079             :                    void g() {
    6080             :                      f(0);   // Problems with this instantiation because
    6081             :                    }         // rescanning N::f changes its meaning.
    6082             :                  }
    6083             :             */
    6084             :             set_to_named_error_locator(locator_for_curr_id);
    6085             :           }  /* if */
    6086             :           if (depth_innermost_function_scope != NO_SCOPE_DEPTH &&
    6087             :               (int)severity <= (int)es_warning) {
    6088             :             check_assertion(gpp_mode);
    6089             :             err_code = ec_qualifier_ignored_on_local_declaration;
    6090             :           } else if (gpp_mode && (input_flags & DI_IS_FRIEND_DECL) &&
    6091             :               (int)severity <= (int)es_warning) {
    6092             :             err_code = ec_friend_qualification_ignored;
    6093             :           } else if (ssep->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_file) {
    6094             :             err_code = ec_nonstd_qualifier_in_global_scope_decl;
    6095             :           } else if ((int)severity <= (int)es_warning) {
    6096             :             err_code = ec_nonstd_qualifier_in_namespace_member_decl;
    6097             :           } else {
    6098             :             err_code = ec_qualifier_in_namespace_member_decl;
    6099             :           }  /* if */
    6100             :           pos_diagnostic(severity, err_code, &pos_curr_token);
    6101             :         } else if (ssep->kind == (a_scope_kind)sck_template_instantiation) {
    6102             :           /* Error has already been issued on the template declaration.
    6103             :              Just skip over it here on the instantiation. */
    6104             :           clear_qualifier_from_locator(&locator_for_curr_id);
    6105             :         }  /* if */
    6106             :       }  /* if */
    6107             :     }  /* if */
    6108             :     /* The declarator may be a qualified name or a normal name. */
    6109             :     if (coalesce_and_lookup_qualified_name(options, lookup_mode, &err)) {

    6474             : 
    6475       28724 : static void check_and_update_upc_type(a_type_ptr       type,
    6476             :                                       a_decl_flag_set  input_flags)
    6477             : /*

    6479             : constraints regarding THREADS-dependent dimensions.  If necessary

    6483             : {

    6500             : #endif /* UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6501             : 
    6502         149 : static void process_conversion_function_declarator(
    6503             :                                              a_symbol_locator    *locator,
    6504             :                                              a_decl_parse_state  *state, 
    6505             :                                              a_decl_flag_set     input_flags,
    6506             :                                              a_type_ptr          derived_type,
    6507             :                                              a_type_ptr          *return_type)
    6508             : /*
    6509             : This is a helper function for r_declarator: locator, state, and input_flags
    6510             : are the corresponding parameters of that function.  locator represents a
    6511             : conversion-function-id in a declarator and the type of that declarator (as
    6512             : known so far) is derived_type.  Record the return type of the function in
    6513             : *return_type, and issue an error if type specifiers appeared prior to the
    6514             : conversion-function-id.  If locator->specific_symbol is an ambiguous symbol
    6515             : but the completed declarator can remove the ambiguity, update
    6516             : locator->specific_symbol to point to the correct symbol entry.
    6517             : */
    6518             : {
    6519         149 :   if (is_error_locator(*locator)) {
    6520           0 :     *return_type = error_type();
    6521             :   } else {
    6522         149 :     a_symbol_ptr  sym = locator->specific_symbol;
    6523         149 :     if (!is_unknown_type(state->specifiers_type) &&
    6524           0 :         !(input_flags & DI_NO_TYPE_SPECIFIERS)) {
    6525           0 :       pos_error(ec_return_type_on_conversion_function, &state->specifiers_pos);
    6526             :     }  /* if */
    6527         149 :     if (sym != NULL && sym->ambiguous &&
    6528           0 :         sym->kind == (a_symbol_kind)sk_member_function &&
    6529           0 :         sym->variant.routine.instance_ptr != NULL &&
    6530           0 :         sym->variant.routine.instance_ptr->template_sym->kind
    6531           0 :                                      == (a_symbol_kind)sk_function_template &&
    6532           0 :         derived_type != NULL && is_function_type(derived_type)) {
    6533             :       /* When the conversion operator name was coalesced, there may have been
    6534             :          multiple matching conversion operator templates but with different
    6535             :          cv-qualifiers.  E.g.:
    6536             :            struct S {
    6537             :              template<class T> operator T();
    6538             :              template<class T> operator T() const;
    6539             :            };
    6540             :            template<> S::operator int() const;
    6541             :          Now that the qualifiers are known, we may be able to disambiguate
    6542             :          such cases. */
    6543           0 :       a_type_ptr  class_type = sym_parent_class(locator->specific_symbol);
    6544           0 :       a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr
    6545           0 :                   cssp = symbol_supplement_for_class(class_type);
    6546           0 :       a_type_ptr  func_type = skip_typerefs(derived_type);
    6547           0 :       a_symbol_ptr  conv_op;
    6548             :       /* Managed class types don't allow cv-qualifiers on member functions:
    6549             :          So we shouldn't get here with managed class types (and hence static
    6550             :          conversion functions do not get here either). */
    6551           0 :       check_assertion(!is_immediate_managed_class_type(class_type));
    6552           0 :       conv_op = find_conversion_template_instance(
    6553             :                        locator, cssp->conversion_template_list,
    6554             :                        /*match_fn_qualifiers=*/TRUE,
    6555           0 :                        func_type->variant.routine.extra_info->qualifiers);
    6556           0 :       locator->specific_symbol = conv_op;
    6557             :     }  /* if */
    6558         149 :     *return_type = locator->variant.conversion_result_type;
    6559             :   }  /* if */
    6560         149 : }  /* process_conversion_function_declarator */
    6561             : 
    6562             : 
    6563      242191 : static a_boolean must_be_function_declarator(a_decl_flag_set input_flags)
    6564             : /*
    6565             : Return TRUE if, from the input_flags and the current context, we can
    6566             : determine that a declaration must be a function declaration and, as a
    6567             : result, disambiguation is not necessary.
    6568             : */
    6569             : {
    6570      242191 :   a_boolean     result = FALSE;
    6571             : 
    6572      242191 :   if ((input_flags & DI_IS_TEMPLATE_DECLARATION) != 0) {
    6573        2615 :     a_scope_stack_entry_ptr     ssep;
    6574        2615 :     check_assertion(depth_template_declaration_scope != NO_SCOPE_DEPTH);
    6575        2615 :     ssep = &scope_stack[depth_template_declaration_scope];
    6576        2615 :     if (ssep->templ_member_class_sym == NULL) {
    6577             :       /* A template declaration that is not a qualified name.  This can
    6578             :          only be a function declaration or a variable template, if they
    6579             :          are enabled. */
    6580        2615 :       result = !variable_templates_enabled;
    6581             :     }  /* if */
    6582      239576 :   } else if (is_real_instantiation_context()) {
    6583         952 :     a_scope_stack_entry_ptr     ssep;
    6584         952 :     ssep = &scope_stack[depth_innermost_instantiation_scope];
    6585         952 :     if (ssep->function_partial_instantiation) {
    6586             :       /* We are rescanning a function declarator to create the partial
    6587             :          instantiation of a function template. */
    6588         944 :       result = TRUE;
    6589             :     }  /* if */
    6590             :   }  /* if */
    6591      242191 :   return result;

    6593             : 
    6594             : 
    6595         771 : static a_boolean type_is_derived_from_function_declarator(a_type_ptr  tp)
    6596             : /*
    6597             : tp is the derived type of a declarator.  Return TRUE if that type is
    6598             : constructed from a function declarator (e.g., a function type or an array of
    6599             : pointer to function type, without intervening typedef/decltype constructors).
    6600             : */
    6601             : {
    6602         771 :   a_boolean  result = FALSE;
    6603             : 
    6604        1542 :   while (tp != NULL) {
    6605         771 :     switch (tp->kind) {
    6606           0 :       case tk_routine:
    6607           0 :         result = TRUE;
    6608           0 :         goto done;
    6609         579 :       case tk_pointer:
    6610         579 :         tp = tp->variant.pointer.type;
    6611         579 :         break;
    6612         192 :       case tk_ptr_to_member:
    6613         192 :         tp = tp->variant.ptr_to_member.type;
    6614         192 :         break;
    6615           0 :       case tk_array:
    6616           0 :         tp = tp->variant.array.element_type;
    6617           0 :         break;
    6618           0 :       case tk_typeref:
    6619           0 :         if (typeref_is_typedef(tp) || typeref_is_type_operator(tp)) {
    6620             :           /* The type from a typedef name or decltype-like construct isn't the
    6621             :              result of the current declarator. */
    6622           0 :           goto done;
    6623             :         } else {
    6624           0 :           tp = tp->variant.typeref.type;
    6625             :         }  /* if */
    6626           0 :         break;
    6627           0 :       default:
    6628           0 :         goto done;
    6629             :     }  /* switch */
    6630             :   }  /* for */
    6631         771 : done:
    6632         771 :   return result;
    6633             : }  /* type_is_derived_from_function_declarator */
    6634             : 
    6635             : 
    6636             : static void cache_struct_bindings_list(a_decl_parse_state    *dps,
    6637             :                                        a_decl_pos_block_ptr  decl_pos_block)
    6638             : /*
    6639             : The current token is a left bracket that looks like the beginning of a
    6640             : structured bindings list.  Cache the list (including the delimiting brackets)
    6641             : and record it in *dps.  Also update positions in decl_pos_block.
    6642             : */
    6643             : {
    6644             :   a_token_cache_ptr  cache = alloc_token_cache();
    6645             : 
    6646             :   check_assertion(curr_token == tok_lbracket);
    6647             :   decl_pos_block->decl_pos = pos_curr_token;
    6648             :   dps->declarator_pos = pos_curr_token;
    6649             :   
    6650             :   if (!dps->auto_type_specifier_seen) {
    6651             :     if (dps->secondary_declarator) {
    6652             :       expect_error();
    6653             :     } else {
    6654             :       pos_error(ec_invalid_struct_binding_specifier, &dps->specifiers_pos);
    6655             :     }  /* if */
    6656             :   }  /* if */
    6657             :   /* Check some constraints early. */
    6658             :   if (dps->dso_flags & DSO_INLINE) {
    6659             :     pos_error(ec_struct_binding_inline, &dps->inline_pos);
    6660             :   } else if (dps->dso_flags & DSO_CONSTEXPR) {
    6661             :     pos_error(ec_struct_binding_constexpr, &dps->constexpr_pos);
    6662             :   } else if (dps->declared_storage_class != (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified ||
    6663             :              (dps->dso_flags & DSO_THREAD_LOCAL) != 0) {
    6664             :     pos_error(ec_struct_binding_storage_class, &dps->storage_class_pos);
    6665             :   }  /* if */
    6666             :   dps->dso_flags &= ~(DSO_INLINE | DSO_CONSTEXPR | DSO_THREAD_LOCAL);
    6667             :   dps->storage_class = (a_storage_class)sc_unspecified;
    6668             :   if (dps->type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_pointer &&
    6669             :       !dps->type->variant.pointer.is_reference) {
    6670             :     pos_error(ec_invalid_struct_binding_syntax, &dps->declarator_start_pos);
    6671             :   }  /* if */
    6672             :   clear_token_cache(cache, /*reusable=*/FALSE);
    6673             :   if (cache_token_stream_until_matching_token(cache, CTS_NO_OPTIONS)) {
    6674             :     /* A syntax error.  We'll run into it again when we parse the cache
    6675             :        later on. */
    6676             :     expect_error();
    6677             :   }  /* if */
    6678             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
    6679             :   decl_pos_block->declarator_range.end = end_pos_curr_token;
    6680             :   curr_construct_end_position = end_pos_curr_token;
    6681             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
    6682             :   cache_curr_token(cache);
    6683             :   (void)get_token();
    6684             :   terminate_token_cache(cache);
    6685             :   dps->is_struct_binding_decl = TRUE;
    6686             :   dps->variant.struct_bindings_cache = cache;
    6687             :   if (!dps->range_based_for) {
    6688             :     /* An initializer should be next. */
    6689             :     if (curr_token != tok_assign && curr_token != tok_lbrace &&
    6690             :         curr_token != tok_lparen) {
    6691             :       pos_error(ec_missing_initializer, &pos_curr_token);
    6692             :     }  /* if */
    6693             :   }  /* if */
    6694             : }  /* cache_struct_bindings_list */
    6695             : 
    6696             : 
    6697             : #if !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || !NEAR_AND_FAR_ALLOWED
    6698             : /*ARGSUSED*/  /* <-- because p_left_call_conv et al. are used only in
    6699             :                      Microsoft mode, and p_left_qualifiers is used only when
    6700             :                      near and far are supported. */
    6701             : #endif /* !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6702             : static void r_declarator(
    6703             :                   a_decl_flag_set             input_flags,
    6704             :                   a_decl_flag_set             *output_flags,
    6705             :                   a_decl_parse_state          *state,
    6706             :                   a_type_ptr                  specifiers_type,
    6707             :                   a_type_ptr                  member_parent_type,
    6708             :                   a_symbol_locator            *locator,
    6709             :                   a_type_ptr                  *p_complete_type,
    6710             :                   a_type_ptr                  *p_bottom_derived_type,
    6711             :                   a_boolean                   *is_constructor,
    6712             :                   a_boolean                   *is_static_constructor,
    6713             :                   a_boolean                   *is_destructor,
    6714             :                   a_boolean                   *is_finalizer,
    6715             :                   a_call_conv_descr_ptr       p_left_call_conv,
    6716             :                   a_call_conv_descr_ptr       p_unbound_call_conv,
    6717             :                   a_type_qualifier_set        *p_left_qualifiers,
    6718             :                   a_type_qualifier_set        *p_unbound_qualifiers,
    6719             :                   an_attribute_ptr            *p_predeclarator_attributes,
    6720             :                   a_source_sequence_entry_ptr *declarator_ssep,
    6721             :                   a_func_info_block           *func_info,
    6722             :                   a_decl_pos_block_ptr        decl_pos_block)
    6723             : /*
    6724             : Scan a declarator or an abstract declarator, depending on the values of the
    6725             : DI_REAL_DECLARATOR_ALLOWED and DI_ABSTRACT_DECLARATOR_ALLOWED flags in
    6726             : input_flags.  input_flags also indicates various other options for parsing
    6727             : (e.g., whether variable-length array declarators should be allowed)
    6728             : and *output_flags returns some properties about the scanned declarator to the
    6729             : caller.  *state contains state information about the declaration being parsed.
    6730             : specifiers_type points to the type scanned in a preceding specifiers list, or
    6731             : is NULL when this routine calls itself to scan a nested declarator.  Return in
    6732             : *locator the symbol table locator and source position for the identifier in
    6733             : the declarator (if only an abstract declarator is allowed, locator is not
    6734             : used; if both real and abstract declarators are allowed, and an abstract
    6735             : declarator is scanned, *locator is set to a null declarator).  Return
    6736             : the final type (declarator derived types, if any, combined with the
    6737             : specifiers type) in *p_complete_type.  If specifiers_type was NULL on
    6738             : entry, *p_complete_type points to just the declarator derived type list
    6739             : (with nothing attached to the bottom), or is NULL if there is no derived
    6740             : type list.  *p_bottom_derived_type is set to point to the bottom type in
    6741             : the declarator derived type list, or NULL if there is no derived type
    6742             : list.  If source sequence entries are enabled, *declarator_ssep is set
    6743             : to point to a source sequence entry for the declaration.  If the top
    6744             : type in the declarator derived type list is a function, *func_info is
    6745             : filled with extra information about the parameter list, for use if a
    6746             : function body follows.  For declarators that may turn out to be member
    6747             : functions, member_parent_type is a pointer to the class (or struct or
    6748             : union) type of which it is a member; otherwise it is NULL.
    6749             : 
    6750             : The routine "declarator" is called at the top level, and it calls
    6751             : this routine to do the actual work.  This routine can call itself
    6752             : recursively to handle nested declarators.
    6753             : 
    6754             : If left-side or unbound qualifiers are detected, they are returned
    6755             : in *p_left_call_conv, *p_unbound_call_conv, *left_qualifiers, and
    6756             : *unbound_qualifiers.  See pointer_declarator for more information
    6757             : on those.
    6758             : 
    6759             : For a nested declarator, *p_predeclarator_attributes is set to any
    6760             : attributes scanned as the first construct in the nested declarator.
    6761             : 
    6762             : The original C89 syntax for declarators is:
    6763             : 
    6764             :        declarator:
    6765             :                 pointer    direct-declarator
    6766             :                        opt
    6767             : 
    6768             :        direct-declarator:
    6769             :                 identifier
    6770             :                 ( declarator )
    6771             :                 direct-declarator [ constant-expression    ]
    6772             :                                                        opt
    6773             :                 direct-declarator ( parameter-type-list )
    6774             :                 direct-declarator ( identifier-list    )
    6775             :                                                    opt
    6776             :        pointer:
    6777             :                 * type-qualifier-list
    6778             :                                      opt
    6779             :                 * type-qualifier-list    pointer
    6780             :                                      opt
    6781             : 
    6782             :        abstract-declarator:
    6783             :                 pointer
    6784             :                 pointer    direct-abstract-declarator
    6785             :                        opt
    6786             : 
    6787             :        direct-abstract-declarator:
    6788             :                 ( abstract-declarator )
    6789             :                 direct-abstract-declarator    [ constant-expression    ]
    6790             :                                           opt                      opt
    6791             :                 direct-abstract-declarator    ( parameter-type-list    )
    6792             :                                           opt                      opt
    6793             : 
    6794             : C++, C99, and dialects thereof add various extensions to this (including
    6795             : reference types, variable-length arrays, calling conventions, attributes,
    6796             : etc.).
    6797             : */
    6798             : {
    6799             :   a_type_ptr            complete_type;
    6800             :   a_type_ptr            derived_type;
    6801             :   a_type_ptr            bottom_derived_type;
    6802             :   a_type_ptr            new_type_ptr;
    6803             :   a_source_position     declarator_pos;
    6804             :   a_boolean             real_declarator_allowed;
    6805             :   a_boolean             abstract_declarator_allowed;
    6806             :   a_boolean             is_name_start;
    6807             :   a_boolean             is_nonstatic_member_function = FALSE;
    6808             :   a_boolean             nonconstant_dimension_allowed = FALSE;
    6809             :   a_boolean             vla_allowed;
    6810             :   a_boolean             vla_asterisk_allowed;
    6811             :   a_boolean             parenthesized_initializer_allowed;
    6812             :   a_boolean             not_a_function_declarator = FALSE;
    6813             :   a_call_conv_descr     left_call_conv, inner_left_call_conv;
    6814             :   a_call_conv_descr     unbound_call_conv;
    6815             :   a_type_qualifier_set  left_qualifiers, inner_left_qualifiers;
    6816             :   a_type_qualifier_set  unbound_qualifiers;
    6817             :   a_boolean             disallow_default_args, disallow_exception_spec;
    6818             :   a_func_info_block     *local_func_info;
    6819             :   a_boolean             threads_dimension_allowed = FALSE;
    6820             :   a_boolean             pointer_to_member_scanned;
    6821             :   a_boolean             parenthesized_new_declarator = FALSE;
    6822             :   a_boolean             allow_one_more_array_dimension = FALSE;
    6823             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6824             :   an_attribute_ptr      predeclarator_attributes = NULL;
    6825             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6826             : 
    6827             :   db_enter(3, "r_declarator");
    6828             :   set_err_pos_to_curr_token();
    6829             :   /* Set declarator_pos to the start of the declarator (which may not be the
    6830             :      position of the declarator-id).  It will be changed later if required. */
    6831             :   copy_source_position(pos_curr_token, declarator_pos);
    6832             :   *output_flags = DO_NO_OUTPUT_FLAGS;
    6833             :   real_declarator_allowed = (input_flags & DI_REAL_DECLARATOR_ALLOWED) != 0;
    6834             :   abstract_declarator_allowed =
    6835             :                           (input_flags & DI_ABSTRACT_DECLARATOR_ALLOWED) != 0;
    6836             :   parenthesized_initializer_allowed =
    6837             :                     (input_flags & DI_PARENTHESIZED_INITIALIZER_ALLOWED) != 0;
    6838             :   if (input_flags & DI_DIMENSION_EXPRESSION_ALLOWED) {
    6839             :     /* A (direct or indirect) call from "new_type_name" to scan a declarator
    6840             :        that is part of a new-expression with a parenthesized type name (in
    6841             :        some GNU modes, part of the declarator may be outside the parentheses).
    6842             :        A top-level array declarator may have a nonconstant dimension in that
    6843             :        case. */
    6844             :     nonconstant_dimension_allowed = TRUE;
    6845             :     if (specifiers_type != NULL) {
    6846             :       /* The top-level declarator. */
    6847             :       parenthesized_new_declarator = TRUE;
    6848             :     }  /* if */
    6849             :   }  /* if */
    6850             :   vla_allowed = (input_flags & DI_VLA_ALLOWED) != 0;
    6851             :   vla_asterisk_allowed = (input_flags & DI_VLA_ASTERISK_ALLOWED) != 0;
    6852             :   if (!real_declarator_allowed) {
    6853             :     func_info = NULL;
    6854             :     locator = NULL;
    6855             :   } else if (input_flags & DI_IS_TYPEDEF_DECLARATION) {
    6856             :     /* Avoid confusing a typedef declaration of a function type with a
    6857             :        function declaration. */
    6858             :     func_info = NULL;
    6859             :   }  /* if */
    6860             :   /* Set the locator to indicate there is no identifier. */
    6861             :   if (locator != NULL) set_to_error_locator(*locator);
    6862             :   /* Scan a list of pointer, reference and pointer-to-member declarators. */
    6863             :   complete_type = pointer_declarator(specifiers_type, state,
    6864             :                                      /*reference_allowed=*/!C_mode(),
    6865             :                                      &left_call_conv, &unbound_call_conv,
    6866             :                                      &left_qualifiers, &unbound_qualifiers,
    6867             :                                      &pointer_to_member_scanned,
    6868             :                                      decl_pos_block);
    6869             :   if (complete_type != NULL && complete_type != specifiers_type) {
    6870             :     /* We scanned a pointer or reference component. */
    6871             :     *output_flags |= DO_HAS_PTR_OR_REF_COMPONENT;
    6872             :     if (pointer_to_member_scanned) {
    6873             :       /* We scanned a pointer-to-member declarator. */
    6874             :       *output_flags |= DO_HAS_PTR_TO_MEMBER_COMPONENT;
    6875             :     }  /* if */
    6876             :     if (specifiers_type != NULL) {
    6877             :       /* E.g., in "int *(*f)()" set state->type and state->declared_type to
    6878             :          "int*" just before processing the nested declarator. */
    6879             :       state->type = state->declared_type = complete_type;
    6880             :     }  /* if */
    6881             :   }  /* if */
    6882             : #if UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6883             :   if (upc_mode && complete_type != NULL &&
    6884             :       is_underlying_shared_qualified_type(complete_type)) {
    6885             :     /* VLAs of UPC shared types are not allowed. */
    6886             :     vla_allowed = FALSE;
    6887             :     threads_dimension_allowed = TRUE;
    6888             :   }  /* if */
    6889             : #endif /* UPC_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6890             :   derived_type = NULL;
    6891             :   bottom_derived_type = NULL;
    6892             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6893             :   if (ms_extensions) clear_call_conv_descr(&inner_left_call_conv);
    6894             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6895             : #if NEAR_AND_FAR_ALLOWED
    6896             :   if (near_and_far_enabled()) inner_left_qualifiers = TQ_NONE;
    6897             : #endif /* NEAR_AND_FAR_ALLOWED */
    6898             :   /* The next thing is an identifier, or a parenthesis that begins a
    6899             :      nested declarator.  For the abstract declarator case, the
    6900             :      identifier is omitted. */
    6901             :   set_err_pos_to_curr_token();
    6902             :   if (curr_token == tok_lparen) {
    6903             :     /* Left parenthesis indicating nested declarator.  For the abstract
    6904             :        declarator case, this might be a parenthesis indicating a function.
    6905             :        We can differentiate the two cases because in the case of a nested
    6906             :        declarator the next tokens must be "*", "(", "[", or "... <id>" whereas
    6907             :        the function case is followed by ")", "...)", or a declaration
    6908             :        specifier. */
    6909             :     a_decl_flag_set       local_do_flags;
    6910             :     a_type_qualifier_set  saved_qualifiers = state->qualifiers;
    6911             :     a_source_position     saved_qualifiers_pos;
    6912             :     a_boolean             saved_in_nested_declarator =
    6913             :                                                   state->in_nested_declarator;
    6914             :     (void)get_token();
    6915             :     { an_attribute_ptr  prescanned_attributes;
    6916             :       /* Scan any attributes, but "unscan" them right away.  We cannot decide
    6917             :          their syntactic location at this time, so we'll "rescan" them once we
    6918             :          know whether we are dealing with a nested declarator or a function
    6919             :          declarator. */ 
    6920             :       prescanned_attributes = scan_attributes(al_prefix);
    6921             :       if (prescanned_attributes != NULL) {
    6922             :         unscan_attributes(prescanned_attributes);
    6923             :       }  /* if */
    6924             :     }
    6925             :     if (abstract_declarator_allowed) {
    6926             :       a_pack_expansion_stack_entry_ptr  pesep = NULL;
    6927             :       a_pack_expansion_descr_ptr        pedp;
    6928             :       a_boolean                         any_args = FALSE;
    6929             :       if (curr_token != tok_rparen) {
    6930             :         /* We could be at the start of a function declarator or a parenthesized
    6931             :            initializer.  Determining which case we have may involve
    6932             :            coalescing an identifier that could be part of a pack expansion.
    6933             :            As a result, we need to push the pack expansion context now.
    6934             :            During a real instantiation of a variadic template with an empty
    6935             :            pack we do further processing and possibly determine whether
    6936             :            this is a function further below. */
    6937             :         any_args = begin_potential_pack_expansion_context_full(
    6938             :                                          &pesep, &pedp, /*is_lookahead=*/TRUE,
    6939             :                                          /*ignore_suppression=*/FALSE);
    6940             :       }  /* if */
    6941             :       if (curr_token == tok_rparen || !any_args ||
    6942             :           is_decl_start(IDS_REAL_DECLARATOR_ALLOWED |
    6943             :                         IDS_MS_ATTRIB_NOT_ALLOWED) ||
    6944             :           (curr_token == tok_ellipsis && next_token() == tok_rparen)) {
    6945             :         /* Function declarator rather than a nested declarator. */
    6946             :         if (curr_token == tok_ellipsis && pesep != NULL) {
    6947             :           /* Beware of (...) in variadic contexts.  Abandon the pack
    6948             :              started above. */
    6949             :           abandon_potential_pack_expansion_context(pesep);
    6950             :         }  /* if */
    6951             :         goto function_lparen;
    6952             :       }  /* if */
    6953             :       if (pesep != NULL) {
    6954             :         /* Abandon this expansion.  A new one may be started later by the
    6955             :            begin_... call later in this routine. */
    6956             :         abandon_potential_pack_expansion_context(pesep);
    6957             :       }  /* if */
    6958             :     }  /* if */
    6959             :     /* This parenthesis begins a nested declarator. */
    6960             :     state->in_nested_declarator = TRUE;
    6961             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    6962             :     predeclarator_attributes = scan_predeclarator_attributes();
    6963             :     if (gnu_mode) {
    6964             :       /* GCC accepts declarations like:
    6965             :              void (__attribute((cdecl)) **p)();
    6966             :          The attributes in that position appertain to the type underlying the
    6967             :          declarator (here, the function type).  Currently, however, we only
    6968             :          take the attributes into account if no nested pointer operators have
    6969             :          been seen.  I.e., we accept:
    6970             :              int *((__attribute((stdcall)) **p2))();
    6971             :          but not:
    6972             :              int (*(__attribute((stdcall)) **p3))();
    6973             :          This is a limitation of how we currently build up types.  E.g., in
    6974             :          the case of p3, the attribute would be applied to a type "pointer
    6975             :          to <null>", which is too little information to determine if the
    6976             :          attribute is valid. */
    6977             :       if (specifiers_type != NULL) {
    6978             :         /* The first level of declarator nesting. */
    6979             :         p_predeclarator_attributes = &predeclarator_attributes;
    6980             :       } else if (complete_type == NULL && p_predeclarator_attributes != NULL) {
    6981             :         /* A more deeply nested level of declarator nesting that hasn't
    6982             :            introduced pointer operators. */
    6983             :         *p_predeclarator_attributes = predeclarator_attributes;
    6984             :         p_predeclarator_attributes = &predeclarator_attributes;
    6985             :       } else {
    6986             :         /* Some nested pointer operators were seen: Don't accept more
    6987             :            predeclarator attributes. */
    6988             :         if (predeclarator_attributes != NULL) {
    6989             :           pos_error(ec_attribute_not_allowed,
    6990             :                     &predeclarator_attributes->position);
    6991             :         }  /* if */
    6992             :         predeclarator_attributes = NULL;
    6993             :         p_predeclarator_attributes = NULL;
    6994             :       }  /* if */
    6995             :       p_predeclarator_attributes =
    6996             :                               last_attribute_link(p_predeclarator_attributes);
    6997             :     }  /* if */
    6998             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    6999             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7000             :     if (ms_extensions) {
    7001             :       if (unbound_call_conv.call_conv != (a_calling_convention)cc_default) {
    7002             :         /* Constructs such as
    7003             :              int __cdecl (*fp)();
    7004             :            are not permitted. */
    7005             :         pos_error(ec_calling_convention_may_not_precede_nested_declarator,
    7006             :                   &declarator_pos);
    7007             :       }  /* if */
    7008             :     }  /* if */
    7009             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7010             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || NEAR_AND_FAR_ALLOWED
    7011             :     if (ms_extensions or_near_and_far_enabled()) {
    7012             :       if (unbound_qualifiers != TQ_NONE) {
    7013             :         /* Constructs such as
    7014             :              int far (*p);
    7015             :            are not permitted. */
    7016             :         pos_error(ec_mem_attrib_may_not_precede_nested_declarator,
    7017             :                   &declarator_pos);
    7018             :       }  /* if */
    7019             :     }  /* if */
    7020             : #endif  /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED || NEAR_AND_FAR_ALLOWED */
    7021             :     add_stop_token(tok_rparen);
    7022             :     /* Call r_declarator recursively to parse the nested declarator.  Some
    7023             :        state must be saved and restored for this call.  For example,
    7024             :        "int const (* const g())()" has two meaningless const qualifiers
    7025             :        that are diagnosed, but when declarator processing is completed,
    7026             :        *state->qualifiers should reflect the outermost qualifier (i.e., the
    7027             :        first one in this example). */
    7028             :     saved_qualifiers = state->qualifiers;
    7029             :     saved_qualifiers_pos = state->qualifiers_pos;
    7030             :     /* Get the nested declarator, removing the flag allowing parenthesized
    7031             :        initializers from the input_flags bit vector.  (The other flags are
    7032             :        passed on in the recursive call.) */
    7033             :     r_declarator((input_flags & ~DI_PARENTHESIZED_INITIALIZER_ALLOWED),
    7034             :                  &local_do_flags, state, /*specifiers_type=*/(a_type_ptr)NULL,
    7035             :                  member_parent_type, locator, &derived_type,
    7036             :                  &bottom_derived_type, is_constructor, is_static_constructor, 
    7037             :                  is_destructor, is_finalizer, &inner_left_call_conv,
    7038             :                  &unbound_call_conv, &inner_left_qualifiers,
    7039             :                  &unbound_qualifiers, p_predeclarator_attributes,
    7040             :                  declarator_ssep, func_info, decl_pos_block);
    7041             :     state->in_nested_declarator = saved_in_nested_declarator;
    7042             :     state->qualifiers = saved_qualifiers;
    7043             :     state->qualifiers_pos = saved_qualifiers_pos;
    7044             :     if (local_do_flags & DO_HAS_PTR_OR_REF_COMPONENT) {
    7045             :       /* A nested declarator that contained a pointer, pointer-to-member, or
    7046             :          reference component.  If we were to scan an array bound next, the
    7047             :          end result would not be a VLA type (instead it would e.g. be a
    7048             :          "pointer to a VLA type" or perhaps something more complicated). */

    7050             :       if (input_flags & DI_VARIABLY_MODIFIED_DECL_ALLOWED) {
    7051             :         vla_allowed = TRUE;

    7054             :       *output_flags |= DO_HAS_PTR_OR_REF_COMPONENT;

    7058             :     }  /* if */
    7059             :     if (local_do_flags & DO_REAL_DECLARATOR_SCANNED) {
    7060             :       *output_flags |= DO_REAL_DECLARATOR_SCANNED;
    7061             :       /* Copy the position of the declarator-id into declarator_pos. */
    7062             :       declarator_pos = error_position;
    7063             :     } else {
    7064             :       parenthesized_initializer_allowed = FALSE;
    7065             :     }  /* if */
    7066             :     if (local_do_flags & DO_CFRONT_MEMBER_FUNCTION_TYPEDEF) {
    7067             :       *output_flags |= DO_CFRONT_MEMBER_FUNCTION_TYPEDEF;
    7068             :       /* Force function_declarator to add an implicit-this-param pointer
    7069             :          to the routine type. */
    7070             :       check_assertion(locator != NULL);
    7071             :       member_parent_type = qualifier_class_type(*locator);
    7072             :       check_assertion(member_parent_type != NULL);
    7073             :     } else if (member_parent_type == NULL && locator != NULL) {
    7074             :       /* In certain error cases (involving parenthesized declarators) the
    7075             :          declaration can be marked as a constructor or destructor but
    7076             :          member_parent_type will be NULL.  In other cases of parenthesized
    7077             :          declarators member_parent_type must be updated from the locator. */
    7078             :       if (is_error_locator(*locator) &&
    7079             :           (*is_constructor || *is_static_constructor ||

    7082             :         *is_destructor = *is_finalizer = FALSE;
    7083             :       } else {
    7084             :         member_parent_type = qualifier_class_type(*locator);
    7085             :       }  /* if */
    7086             :     }  /* if */
    7087             :     if (local_do_flags & DO_SCOPE_DEACTIVATION_REQUIRED) {
    7088             :       /* A class scope was reactivated to scan a static data member or a
    7089             :          member function.  It will have to be deactivated when the scanning
    7090             :          of the top-level declarator is complete. */
    7091             :       *output_flags |= DO_SCOPE_DEACTIVATION_REQUIRED;
    7092             :     }  /* if */
    7093             :     /* A nonconstant dimension, if allowed at all, is allowed only on the
    7094             :        topmost type.  Set the flag to FALSE for subsequent processing. */
    7095             :     nonconstant_dimension_allowed = FALSE;
    7096             :     /* Check for and get the closing parenthesis. */
    7097             :     (void)required_token(tok_rparen, ec_exp_rparen);
    7098             :     remove_stop_token(tok_rparen);
    7099             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7100             :     if (curr_token == tok_attribute && !state->in_nested_declarator) {
    7101             :       /* GNU attributes may appear after the outermost nested declarator.
    7102             :          They are treated as declarator-id attributes. */
    7103             :       scan_gnu_declarator_attributes(state);
    7104             :     }  /* if */
    7105             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7106             :   } else {
    7107             :     /* Not a nested declarator. */
    7108             :     a_source_position  ellipsis_pos;
    7109             :     /* Check for a declarator-id or abstract declarator that starts with an
    7110             :        ellipsis indicating a parameter pack.  There is an ambiguity in this
    7111             :        context where the ellipsis can either indicate a parameter pack for an
    7112             :        abstract declarator, or a classic vararg function: It is the former
    7113             :        only if the specifiers type is a pattern.  E.g.:
    7114             :          template<typename ... T> void f(T ...);  // Parameter pack.
    7115             :          template<typename T>     void f(T ...);  // Classic vararg function.
    7116             :        */
    7117             :     if (variadic_templates_enabled && curr_token == tok_ellipsis &&
    7118             :         (next_token() != tok_rparen || any_packs_referenced())) {
    7119             :       /* An ellipsis at this point can indicate a parameter pack. */
    7120             :       if (state->pack_ellipsis_allowed) {
    7121             :         state->has_pack_ellipsis = TRUE;
    7122             :         ellipsis_pos = pos_curr_token;
    7123             :         /* For function parameter pack declarations, the ellipsis is a sort of
    7124             :            expansion (the type of the parameter must be a "pattern"), but for
    7125             :            template parameter declarations that is sometimes not the case.
    7126             :            Something like a template parameter "int ...N" is a pack declaration
    7127             :            and not an expansion.  But for a template parameter that expands
    7128             :            an enclosing pack (e.g., "Enclosing_T ... N"), it is a pack
    7129             :            expansion. */
    7130             :         if ((input_flags & DI_IS_TEMPLATE_PARAM_DECL) != 0 &&
    7131             :             (input_flags & DI_IS_TEMPLATE_PARAM_PACK_EXPANSION) == 0) {
    7132             :           (void)get_token();
    7133             :         } else {
    7134             :           record_pack_expansion_ellipsis();
    7135             :         }  /* if */
    7136             :       } else {
    7137             :         /* An error will be issued elsewhere if it turns out we are not
    7138             :            in an expansion. */
    7139             :       }  /* if */
    7140             :     }  /* if */
    7141             :     /* An identifier is expected next, but is omitted in the 
    7142             :        abstract declarator. */
    7143             :     is_name_start = (is_decl_qualified_name_start() ||
    7144             :                      curr_token == tok_operator || curr_token == tok_compl
    7145             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7146             :                      || (cli_or_cx_enabled && curr_token == tok_not)
    7147             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7148             :                                                                           );
    7149             :     if (!real_declarator_allowed ||
    7150             :         (abstract_declarator_allowed && !is_name_start)) {
    7151             :       /* Identifier is omitted in an abstract declarator.  Be sure it is not a
    7152             :          tk_unknown type. */

    7154             :         /* Disallow a pack ellipsis in a nested abstract declarator. */
    7155             :         if (specifiers_type == NULL) {
    7156             :           pos_error(ec_abstract_declarator_pack_is_nested, &ellipsis_pos);
    7157             :         }  /* if */
    7158             :       }  /* if */
    7159             :       check_assertion(specifiers_type == NULL ||
    7160             :                       !is_unknown_type(specifiers_type) ||
    7161             :                       (complete_type != NULL &&
    7162             :                        is_or_contains_error_type(complete_type)));
    7163             :       parenthesized_initializer_allowed = FALSE;
    7164             :     } else if (curr_token == tok_lbracket && struct_bindings_enabled &&

    7166             :                !state->in_class_scope) {
    7167             :       /* This looks like the bracket introducing a list of structured
    7168             :          bindings. */
    7169             :       declarator_pos = pos_curr_token;
    7170             :       make_struct_binding_container_locator(locator, &declarator_pos);
    7171             :       cache_struct_bindings_list(state, decl_pos_block);
    7172             :       goto past_postfix_declarator_operators;
    7173             :     } else {
    7174             :       /* Real (non-abstract) declarator. */
    7175             :       check_assertion(locator != NULL);
    7176             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    7177             : #if DEBUG
    7178             :       if (!source_sequence_entries_disallowed &&
    7179             :           (debug_level >= 4 || db_flag_is_set("dump_ss_full"))) {
    7180             :         fprintf(f_debug, "declarator: empty ss entry for \"%s\":\n",
    7181             :                 curr_token == tok_identifier ?
    7182             :                   locator_for_curr_id.symbol_header->identifier :
    7183             :                   token_names[(int)curr_token]);
    7184             :       }  /* if */
    7185             : #endif /* DEBUG */
    7186             :       *declarator_ssep = add_empty_source_sequence_entry();
    7187             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    7188             :       if (state->p_postfix_entities != NULL) {
    7189             :         /* If we're in a declaration statement, record the end of the
    7190             :            associated entities list. */
    7191             :         while (*state->p_postfix_entities != NULL) {
    7192             :           state->p_postfix_entities = &(*state->p_postfix_entities)->next;
    7193             :         }  /* while */
    7194             :       }  /* if */
    7195             :       *output_flags |= DO_REAL_DECLARATOR_SCANNED;
    7196             :       /* Process the name declared here. */
    7197             :       scan_real_declarator_id(state, input_flags, output_flags, locator,
    7198             :                               is_constructor, is_static_constructor, 
    7199             :                               is_destructor, is_finalizer,
    7200             :                               &parenthesized_initializer_allowed,
    7201             :                               &not_a_function_declarator,
    7202             :                               &member_parent_type, decl_pos_block);
    7203             :       /* Type attributes may have changed state->declared_type, which should
    7204             :          stay in sync with complete_type in non-nested contexts. */
    7205             :       if (!state->in_nested_declarator) {
    7206             :         complete_type = state->declared_type;
    7207             :       }  /* if */
    7208             :       /* Reset declarator_pos to correspond to the position of the
    7209             :          declarator-id.  Doing this after the call to scan_real_declarator_id
    7210             :          ensures the position is that of the main identifier (and not e.g.
    7211             :          a qualifier). */
    7212             :       declarator_pos = locator->source_position;
    7213             :       decl_pos_block->decl_pos = declarator_pos;
    7214             :     }  /* if */
    7215             :   }  /* if */
    7216             :   consume_any_stray_microsoft_rparen();
    7217             :   /* The declarator can end at this point, or an array or function
    7218             :      specification (or a series of them) can follow.  The additional
    7219             :      specifications, if they appear, are parsed in their order of 
    7220             :      appearance.  However, the resulting type has to be built from
    7221             :      the top down, which makes the logic a bit convoluted.  For example,
    7222             : 
    7223             :      int a[3][4];
    7224             : 
    7225             :      is a 3-element array, each of whose elements is a four-element
    7226             :      int array.  The type "array[3] of" is built on the first iteration;
    7227             :      on the second iteration the type "array[4] of" is built, and
    7228             :      the new type is added to the end of the existing list, giving
    7229             :      "array[3] of array[4] of".  Then the loop ends, and the array
    7230             :      type is attached to the original type "int" (from complete_type).
    7231             : 
    7232             :      If a nested declarator was scanned above, there may already be
    7233             :      a derived type list, and the new entries are added to its bottom.
    7234             :   */
    7235             :   while (curr_token == tok_lparen || curr_token == tok_lbracket ||
    7236             :          curr_token == tok_rparen) {
    7237             :     if (curr_token == tok_rparen) {
    7238             :       /* Normally, a right parenthesis at this point is not part of the
    7239             :          declarator.  An exception occurs when emulating the new-expression
    7240             :          syntax of early GNU C++ compilers.  For example, "new (int[n])[3]"
    7241             :          treats the "[3]" as part of the type being allocated.  Only one
    7242             :          (array) declarator level is allowed after the right parentheses in
    7243             :          those cases. */
    7244             :       if (parenthesized_new_declarator && gpp_mode && gnu_version < 30400 &&
    7245             :           next_token() == tok_lbracket) {
    7246             :         (void)get_token();
    7247             :         remove_stop_token(tok_rparen);
    7248             :         *output_flags |= DO_RPAREN_IN_NEW_DECLARATOR;
    7249             :         allow_one_more_array_dimension = TRUE;
    7250             :       } else {
    7251             :         break;
    7252             :       }  /* if */
    7253             :     }  /* if */
    7254             :     if (curr_token == tok_lparen) {
    7255             :       /* Appears to be a function declarator.  But be sure it's not the
    7256             :          start of a parenthesized initializer (C++ only). */
    7257             :       a_source_position  lparen_pos;
    7258             :       lparen_pos = pos_curr_token;
    7259             :       /* Advance past the left parenthesis. */
    7260             :       (void)get_token();
    7261             :       if (parenthesized_initializer_allowed &&
    7262             :           curr_token != tok_rparen && curr_token != tok_ellipsis) {
    7263             :         /* The context and other information we have about the declarator do
    7264             :            not preclude a parenthesized initializer, nor does the token that
    7265             :            follows the left paren.  If the construct inside the parentheses
    7266             :            could be interpreted as a declaration, then do so.  Otherwise,
    7267             :            treat this as a parenthesized initializer.  The
    7268             :            not_a_function_declarator flag is set when the declarator-id is
    7269             :            scanned if the name found is a qualified name that names a static
    7270             :            data member.  This is used in template cases when implicit typename
    7271             :            is enabled because is_decl_not_expr can return an incorrect result
    7272             :            in such cases.  In other cases, we still use is_decl_not_expr
    7273             :            because it provides for better diagnostics later on. */
    7274             :         a_pack_expansion_stack_entry_ptr        pesep;
    7275             :         a_pack_expansion_descr_ptr              pedp;
    7276             :         a_boolean                               any_args;
    7277             :         /* We could be at the start of a function declarator or a parenthesized
    7278             :            initializer.  Determining which case we have may involve
    7279             :            coalescing an identifier that could be part of a pack expansion.
    7280             :            As a result, we need to push the pack expansion context now.
    7281             :            During a real instantiation of a variadic template with an empty
    7282             :            pack, we should rely on the value of is_function_declarator saved
    7283             :            during the prototype instantiation to determine whether or not
    7284             :            this is a function. */
    7285             :         any_args = begin_potential_pack_expansion_context_full(
    7286             :                                          &pesep, &pedp, /*is_lookahead=*/TRUE,
    7287             :                                          /*ignore_suppression=*/FALSE);
    7288             :         if (!is_template_dependent_context() && pedp != NULL) {
    7289             :           /* This is a real instantiation.  If we found a function declarator
    7290             :              in the prototype instantiation, treat this as one now. */
    7291             :           if (pedp->is_function_declarator) goto function_lparen;
    7292             :         }  /* if */
    7293             :         if ((!any_args && pedp != NULL && !pedp->is_function_declarator) ||
    7294             :             (not_a_function_declarator && use_implicit_typename() &&
    7295             :              is_template_dependent_context()) ||
    7296             :             (!must_be_function_declarator(input_flags) &&
    7297             :              !is_decl_not_expr(DFS_ABSTRACT_DECLARATOR_ALLOWED |
    7298             :                               DFS_REAL_DECLARATOR_ALLOWED))) {
    7299             :           a_boolean  is_function_decl = FALSE;
    7300             :           /* This appears to be a parenthesized initializer.  However, it
    7301             :              might also be a function definition with an old-style parameter
    7302             :              list.  If, starting with the current token, we have a comma-
    7303             :              separated list of identifiers followed by a right paren followed
    7304             :              by a left brace or the start of a declaration, then this can
    7305             :              only be a function definition.  Otherwise assume it to be a
    7306             :              parenthesized initializer.  GNU C++ does not accept old-style
    7307             :              parameter lists. */
    7308             :           if (!any_args && pedp != NULL && !pedp->is_function_declarator) {
    7309             :             /* We know from the prototype instantiation that this is a
    7310             :                parenthesized initializer. */
    7311             :           } else if (curr_token == tok_identifier && !gpp_mode) {
    7312             :             a_token_cache       cache;
    7313             :             clear_token_cache(&cache, /*reusable=*/FALSE);
    7314             :             cache_curr_token(&cache);
    7315             :             /* Advance past all comma-identifier pairs till what should be
    7316             :                the closing paren. */
    7317             :             while (get_token() == tok_comma) {
    7318             :               cache_curr_token(&cache);
    7319             :               if (get_token() == tok_identifier) {
    7320             :                 cache_curr_token(&cache);
    7321             :               } else {
    7322             :                 break;
    7323             :               }  /* if */
    7324             :             }  /* while */
    7325             :             /* If there is a closing paren, see if the next token is the
    7326             :                start of a declaration or else a left brace introducing the
    7327             :                function body. */
    7328             :             if (curr_token == tok_rparen) {
    7329             :               cache_curr_token(&cache);
    7330             :               if (get_token() == tok_lbrace ||
    7331             :                   is_decl_start(IDS_REAL_DECLARATOR_ALLOWED)) {
    7332             :                 /* This looks exactly like a function declaration with an
    7333             :                    old style parameter list. */
    7334             :                 is_function_decl = TRUE;
    7335             :               }  /* if */
    7336             :             }  /* if */
    7337             :             rescan_cached_tokens(&cache);
    7338             :           }  /* if */
    7339             :           if (!is_function_decl) {
    7340             :             *output_flags |= DO_PARENTHESIZED_INITIALIZER;
    7341             :             if (decl_pos_block != NULL) {
    7342             :               decl_pos_block->var_init_range.start = lparen_pos;
    7343             :             }  /* if */
    7344             :             /* Function_declarator should not be called, so exit the loop. */
    7345             :             break;
    7346             :           }  /* if */
    7347             :         }  /* if */
    7348             :         /* Save the knowledge that this should be processed as a function
    7349             :            declarator (note that we only get here with pedp non-NULL in
    7350             :            template dependent contexts). */
    7351             :         if (pedp != NULL) pedp->is_function_declarator = TRUE;
    7352             :       }  /* if */
    7353             : function_lparen:
    7354             :       /* For function types as the top type, fetch the extra function info
    7355             :          as well.  For non-top types, do not. */
    7356             :       local_func_info = func_info;
    7357             :       if (C_dialect == C_dialect_cplusplus) {
    7358             :         if (derived_type != NULL) {
    7359             :           /* If the function is pointed to by a pointer-to-member type, we need
    7360             :              to pass the class-of-which-a-member to function_declarator. */
    7361             :           a_type_ptr tp = bottom_derived_type;
    7362             :           if (tp != NULL && is_ptr_to_member_type(tp)) {
    7363             :             /* Declaration of a pointer to member function. */
    7364             :             member_parent_type = pm_class_type(tp);
    7365             :             is_nonstatic_member_function = TRUE;
    7366             :           } else {
    7367             :             member_parent_type = NULL;
    7368             :           }  /* if */
    7369             :           local_func_info = NULL;
    7370             :           *is_constructor = *is_static_constructor = FALSE;
    7371             :           *is_destructor = *is_finalizer = FALSE;
    7372             :         } else if (*output_flags & DO_CFRONT_MEMBER_FUNCTION_TYPEDEF) {
    7373             :           check_assertion(func_info == NULL);
    7374             :           is_nonstatic_member_function = TRUE;
    7375             :           *is_constructor = *is_static_constructor = FALSE;
    7376             :           *is_destructor = *is_finalizer = FALSE;
    7377             :         } else if (func_info == NULL) {
    7378             :           is_nonstatic_member_function = FALSE;
    7379             :           *is_constructor = *is_static_constructor = FALSE;
    7380             :           *is_destructor = *is_finalizer = FALSE;
    7381             :           member_parent_type = NULL;
    7382             :         } else if (*is_constructor || *is_destructor || *is_finalizer) {
    7383             :           is_nonstatic_member_function = TRUE;
    7384             :           if ((*output_flags & DO_HAS_PTR_OR_REF_COMPONENT) &&
    7385             :               !(state->dso_flags & DSO_HAS_EXPLICIT_TYPE_SPECIFIER)) {
    7386             :             /* Something like "*~D()". */
    7387             :             pos_error(*is_constructor ? ec_bad_constructor_decl :
    7388             :                       *is_destructor  ? ec_bad_destructor_decl
    7389             :                                       : ec_bad_finalizer_decl,
    7390             :                       &state->declarator_start_pos);
    7391             :           }  /* if */
    7392             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7393             :         } else if (*is_static_constructor) {
    7394             :           is_nonstatic_member_function = FALSE;
    7395             :         } else if (cli_or_cx_enabled &&
    7396             :                    in_static_cli_property_or_event_definition()) {
    7397             :           /* Accessor functions for static C++/CLI properties and events are
    7398             :              always static member functions. */
    7399             :           is_nonstatic_member_function = FALSE;
    7400             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7401             :         } else {
    7402             :           if (input_flags & DI_NONSTATIC_MEMBER) {
    7403             :             if (locator->is_operator_name &&
    7404             :                 (is_new_operator(locator->variant.opname) ||
    7405             :                  is_delete_operator(locator->variant.opname))) {
    7406             :               /* operator new and operator delete are always static, even
    7407             :                  if "static" was not specified in the declaration. */
    7408             :             } else {
    7409             :               is_nonstatic_member_function = TRUE;
    7410             :             }  /* if */
    7411             :           }  /* if */
    7412             :         }  /* if */
    7413             :         if (is_nonstatic_member_function) {
    7414             :           state->is_nonstatic_member_function_decl = TRUE;
    7415             :         }  /* if */
    7416             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7417             :         if (microsoft_mode && is_nonstatic_member_function &&
    7418             :             member_parent_type != NULL && derived_type == NULL &&
    7419             :             !(input_flags & DI_IS_TYPEDEF_DECLARATION) &&
    7420             :             scope_stack[decl_scope_level].kind ==
    7421             :                                        (a_scope_kind)sck_class_struct_union &&
    7422             :             depth_innermost_instantiation_scope < decl_scope_level) {
    7423             :           /* Microsoft mode allows for "selective virtual overriders" in which
    7424             :              a qualified name is used for a member function declaration.
    7425             :              However, in that case the member_parent_type is not the type
    7426             :              used as a qualifier, but the enclosing class.  This is only an
    7427             :              issue for top-level type declarators scanned in class scope. */
    7428             :           member_parent_type = scope_stack[decl_scope_level].assoc_type;
    7429             :         }  /* if */
    7430             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7431             :       } else {
    7432             :         /* Normal C case.  If the derived type is nonnull this is not the
    7433             :            top-most type, so we don't want to fetch the extra function info. */
    7434             :         if (derived_type != NULL) local_func_info = NULL;
    7435             :       }  /* if */
    7436             :       /* Pass in a flag to indicate whether default arguments are allowed at
    7437             :          all.  They should be disallowed on top-level function declarations
    7438             :          for explicit template instantiations and template specializations --
    7439             :          for instance:
    7440             :            template <class T> void f(T) { ... }
    7441             :            template<> void f(int=0);
    7442             :            template void f(char=0);
    7443             :          (However, Microsoft and GNU compilers allow the default arguments on
    7444             :          explicit instantiations.)
    7445             :          In addition, default arguments are disallowed in template parameter
    7446             :          declarations. */
    7447             :       disallow_default_args = C_mode() ||
    7448             :                               (input_flags & DI_IS_TEMPLATE_PARAM_DECL);
    7449             :       if (local_func_info != NULL) {
    7450             :         if ((input_flags & DI_IS_SPECIALIZATION) != 0) {
    7451             :           disallow_default_args = TRUE;
    7452             :         } else if ((input_flags & DI_IS_EXPLICIT_INSTANTIATION) != 0 &&
    7453             :                    !(gpp_mode || microsoft_mode)) {
    7454             :           disallow_default_args = TRUE;
    7455             :         }  /* if */
    7456             :       }  /* if */
    7457             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7458             :       /* Default arguments are also disallowed for generic functions and for
    7459             :          members of managed class types. */
    7460             :       if (cppcx_enabled && member_parent_type != NULL &&
    7461             :           is_ref_class_type(member_parent_type)) {
    7462             :         /* Non-public C++/CX ref class methods do permit default arguments. */
    7463             :       } else if (cli_or_cx_enabled &&
    7464             :                  (state->is_generic_declaration ||
    7465             :                   (is_nonstatic_member_function &&
    7466             :                    member_parent_type != NULL &&
    7467             :                    is_immediate_managed_class_type(member_parent_type)))) {
    7468             :         disallow_default_args = TRUE;
    7469             :       }  /* if */
    7470             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7471             :       /* Pass in a flag to indicate whether exception specifications are
    7472             :          allowed.  C++17 made a change that allows them on all function
    7473             :          declarators (enabled when exc_spec_in_func_type is TRUE).  Otherwise,
    7474             :          they are allowed on a declaration of a function, a pointer or
    7475             :          reference to function, or a pointer to member function.  The
    7476             :          declaration must be a top-level declaration, a parameter declaration,
    7477             :          or a return type; it cannot be a typedef declaration.  That turns out
    7478             :          to correspond to places where real declarators are allowed.  GNU and
    7479             :          Microsoft compilers also allow exception specifications in other
    7480             :          places (e.g., types in casts) and we also allow it as an extension
    7481             :          in other nonstrict modes. */
    7482             :       if (C_mode()) {
    7483             :         disallow_exception_spec = TRUE;
    7484             :       } else if (exc_spec_in_func_type) {
    7485             :         disallow_exception_spec = FALSE;
    7486             :       } else {
    7487             :         disallow_exception_spec = TRUE;
    7488             :         if (!(input_flags & DI_IS_TYPEDEF_DECLARATION) &&
    7489             :             ((input_flags & DI_REAL_DECLARATOR_ALLOWED) ||
    7490             :              !strict_ansi_mode)) {
    7491             :           if (derived_type == NULL ||
    7492             :               type_is_derived_from_function_declarator(derived_type)) {
    7493             :             /* Top level function declaration, or return type of function
    7494             :                type. */
    7495             :             disallow_exception_spec = FALSE;
    7496             :           } else if (is_any_ptr_or_ref_type(derived_type)) {
    7497             :             /* If derived_type is a pointer or reference type that currently
    7498             :                points to NULL, this can be assumed to be a top-level pointer
    7499             :                or reference declaration, and an exception specification is
    7500             :                permitted:
    7501             :                  void (*pf)() throw();    // Okay
    7502             :                  void (**ppf)() throw();  // Error
    7503             :                (Handle and tracking-reference types cannot refer to function
    7504             :                types, but there is no need to produce an additional diagnostic
    7505             :                for the exception specification.) */
    7506             :             disallow_exception_spec = (type_pointed_to(derived_type) != NULL);
    7507             :           } else if (is_ptr_to_member_type(derived_type)) {
    7508             :             /* Similarly if derived_type is a pointer-to-member type whose
    7509             :                member pointer is NULL:
    7510             :                  void (A::*pmf)() throw ();  // Okay
    7511             :                  void (A::**ppmf)() throw(); // Error
    7512             :                  void (* A::*pm)() throw();  // Error
    7513             :             */
    7514             :             disallow_exception_spec = (pm_member_type(derived_type) != NULL);
    7515             :           }  /* if */
    7516             :         }  /* if */
    7517             :       }  /* if */
    7518             :       function_declarator(state, input_flags, &new_type_ptr, local_func_info,
    7519             :                           locator, member_parent_type,
    7520             :                           is_nonstatic_member_function,
    7521             :                           *is_constructor, *is_static_constructor,
    7522             :                           *is_destructor, *is_finalizer,
    7523             :                           disallow_default_args, disallow_exception_spec,
    7524             :                           decl_pos_block);
    7525             :       if (state->has_trailing_return_type) {
    7526             :         /* function_declarator encountered a trailing return type (which means
    7527             :            that "complete_type" corresponded to a simple "auto").  Replace the
    7528             :            "auto" placeholder type by the actual return type (which was
    7529             :            recorded as the specifiers_type in *state). */
    7530             :         check_assertion(complete_type == state->auto_type);
    7531             :         complete_type = state->specifiers_type;
    7532             :       }  /* if */
    7533             :       if (local_func_info != NULL &&
    7534             :           (input_flags & DI_IS_EXPLICIT_INSTANTIATION) != 0 &&
    7535             :           local_func_info->any_default_args) {
    7536             :         pos_warning(ec_nonstd_default_arg, &locator->source_position);
    7537             :       }  /* if */
    7538             :       /* Check that we do not create a typedef for a pointer or reference to a
    7539             :          qualified function type.  (We don't check C++/CLI handles and tracking
    7540             :          references here because they cannot refer to function types;
    7541             :          additional diagnostics would not be helpful.) */
    7542             :       if (new_type_ptr->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_routine &&
    7543             :           derived_type != NULL && is_ptr_or_ref_type(derived_type)) {
    7544             :         a_routine_type_supplement_ptr  rtsp =
    7545             :                                      new_type_ptr->variant.routine.extra_info;
    7546             :         if (rtsp->this_class == NULL &&
    7547             :             (rtsp->qualifiers | rtsp->this_qualifiers) != TQ_NONE) {
