    7549             :                 typedef void (*PF)() const;
    7550             :              Qualified function types are only allowed to declare members,
    7551             :              pointer-to-members and synonym typedefs. */
    7552             :           pos_error(ec_ptr_or_ref_to_qualified_function_type,
    7553             :                     locator != NULL ? &locator->source_position
    7554             :                                     : &lparen_pos);
    7555             :         }  /* if */
    7556             :       }  /* if */
    7557             : #if GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS
    7558             :       if (func_info != NULL) {
    7559             :         /* Record the source sequence entry in func_info even if there was

    7561             :            locator).  This could mean an empty source sequence entry is in
    7562             :            the list when there's an error, but that should be okay. */
    7563             :         func_info->declarator_ssep = *declarator_ssep;

    7565             : #endif /* GENERATE_SOURCE_SEQUENCE_LISTS */
    7566             :     } else {
    7567             :       /* Left bracket, indicating array declarator. */
    7568             :       a_boolean  top_level_field_decl, top_level_param_decl;

    7570             :          declaration only if the nonstatic member flag is set.  (Note: it
    7571             :          will be set for fields in C mode as well as in C++ mode.) */
    7572             :       top_level_field_decl = (input_flags & DI_NONSTATIC_MEMBER) &&
    7573             :                              derived_type == NULL;

    7575             :          declaration. */
    7576             :       top_level_param_decl = (input_flags & DI_IS_PARAMETER_DECL) &&
    7577             :                              derived_type == NULL;

    7580             :                        threads_dimension_allowed, top_level_field_decl,
    7581             :                        top_level_param_decl, decl_pos_block);

    7583             :         /* In C++ a array declarator that appears in an operator new()
    7584             :            expression may have a nonconstant expression in the first
    7585             :            dimension (ARM 5.3.3).  Subsequent dimensions must be constants. */
    7586             :         nonconstant_dimension_allowed = FALSE;
    7587             :       }  /* if */
    7588             :     }  /* if */
    7589             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7590             :     if (specifiers_type != NULL && predeclarator_attributes != NULL) {

    7592             :          function type.  Note that this means attribute application routines
    7593             :          must deal with partially assembled types. */
    7594             :       attach_type_attributes(&new_type_ptr, predeclarator_attributes,
    7595             :                              (void*)state);
    7596             :       predeclarator_attributes = NULL;

    7598             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7599             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7600             :     if (ms_extensions) {
    7601             :       /* Apply left-side qualifiers that were hanging:
    7602             :            int (__cdecl *f)();
    7603             :                              ^ We're here now.
    7604             :                 ^ inner_left_call_conv indicates this.
    7605             :          The __cdecl calling convention was returned from the nested
    7606             :          declarator scan and goes on top of the function type. */
    7607             :       if (inner_left_call_conv.call_conv != (a_calling_convention)cc_default) {

    7610             :                                                   : &declarator_pos);

    7612             :     }  /* if */
    7613             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7614             : #if NEAR_AND_FAR_ALLOWED
    7615             :     if (near_and_far_enabled()) {
    7616             :       if (inner_left_qualifiers != TQ_NONE) {
    7617             :         if (new_type_ptr->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_array) {
    7618             :           /* A case like
    7619             :                int (__near *p)[5];

    7621             :              go on the element type and the element type is not attached yet.
    7622             :              Leave them in inner_left_qualifiers for the next time around the
    7623             :              loop. */
    7624             :         } else {
    7625             :           /* Function case.  The qualifiers can be added now. */
    7626             :           new_type_ptr = make_qualified_type(new_type_ptr,
    7627             :                                              inner_left_qualifiers);
    7628             :           inner_left_qualifiers = TQ_NONE;
    7629             :         }  /* if */
    7630             :       }  /* if */
    7631             :     }  /* if */
    7632             : #endif  /* NEAR_AND_FAR_ALLOWED */
    7633             :     /* Type attributes may have changed state->declared_type, which should
    7634             :        stay in sync with complete_type in non-nested contexts. */
    7635             :     if (!state->in_nested_declarator) {
    7636             :       complete_type = state->declared_type;
    7637             :     }  /* if */
    7638             :     /* Add the new type to the bottom of the existing derived type list.
    7639             :        Note that this involves error checking. */
    7640             :     add_to_derived_type_list(new_type_ptr, &derived_type, &bottom_derived_type,
    7641             :                              state, (input_flags & DI_IS_PARAMETER_DECL) != 0);
    7642             :     consume_any_stray_microsoft_rparen();
    7643             :     if (allow_one_more_array_dimension) {
    7644             :       break;
    7645             :     }  /* if */
    7646             :   }  /* while */
    7647             : past_postfix_declarator_operators:
    7648             :   /* Set the referenced flag on the specifiers type if this is the top-level
    7649             :      scan of the declarator (i.e., if specifiers_type is non-NULL) -- but
    7650             :      do this only if a real declarator was scanned.  This enables us to
    7651             :      properly handle tags whose definitions appear in the declaration of
    7652             :      another entity -- e.g., "struct S {int a;} x", where there is no reference
    7653             :      to S by tag name (and so the symbol's referenced flag is not set) but
    7654             :      there IS a use of the IL entity (and therefore the reference flag in the
    7655             :      type entry is set).  (Compare this to "struct S {int a;}; struct S x",
    7656             :      where the reference to (use of) the type appears with the reference
    7657             :      to the tag name.)  As written, this sets the referenced flag for all
    7658             :      types, not just tags, which is harmless. */
    7659             :   if (specifiers_type != NULL) {
    7660             :     (skip_typerefs(specifiers_type))->source_corresp.referenced = TRUE;
    7661             :   }  /* if */
    7662             :   /* Use the position of the identifier as the position of this declarator
    7663             :      for error purposes.  If this was an abstract declarator, declarator_pos
    7664             :      has been set to the beginning of the declarator.  The error position
    7665             :      is set a bit early here so that any errors below from combining the
    7666             :      two lists will have the right position. */
    7667             :   copy_source_position(declarator_pos, error_position);
    7668             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7669             :   if (specifiers_type != NULL && predeclarator_attributes != NULL) {
    7670             :     /* Apply the nested predeclarator attributes to the type specified
    7671             :        before the nested declarator (if there were postfix declarator
    7672             :        operators, the attributes were already consumed above). */
    7673             :     attach_type_attributes(&complete_type, predeclarator_attributes,
    7674             :                            (void*)state);
    7675             :     predeclarator_attributes = NULL;
    7676             :   }  /* if */
    7677             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7678             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7679             :   if (ms_extensions) {
    7680             :     /* Apply left-side qualifiers that were hanging, for the case where
    7681             :        there were no function or array declarators:
    7682             :          typedef void F(int);
    7683             :          F (__cdecl *f);
    7684             :                        ^ We're here now.
    7685             :             ^ inner_left_call_conv indicates this.
    7686             :        The __cdecl calling convention was returned from the nested
    7687             :        declarator scan and goes on top of the complete type.  If there
    7688             :        is no complete type, move these hanging left-side qualifiers to
    7689             :        the variables that will apply them to the specifiers type. */
    7690             :     if (inner_left_call_conv.call_conv != (a_calling_convention)cc_default) {
    7691             :       if (complete_type != NULL) {
    7692             :         update_calling_convention(&complete_type, &inner_left_call_conv,
    7693             :                                   state, &declarator_pos);
    7694             :       } else {
    7695             :         check_assertion(left_call_conv.call_conv ==
    7696             :                         (a_calling_convention)cc_default);
    7697             :         left_call_conv = inner_left_call_conv;
    7698             :       }  /* if */
    7699             :     }  /* if */
    7700             :     /* Return the left calling convention to the caller if it can't be
    7701             :        handled at this level (i.e., in a nested declarator). */
    7702             :     if (specifiers_type == NULL) *p_left_call_conv = left_call_conv;
    7703             :   }  /* if */
    7704             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7705             : #if NEAR_AND_FAR_ALLOWED
    7706             :   if (near_and_far_enabled()) {
    7707             :     if (inner_left_qualifiers != TQ_NONE) {
    7708             :       if (complete_type != NULL) {
    7709             :         check_for_addition_of_incompatible_qualifiers(complete_type,
    7710             :                                                       &inner_left_qualifiers,
    7711             :                                                       &declarator_pos);
    7712             :         complete_type = make_qualified_type(complete_type,
    7713             :                                             inner_left_qualifiers);
    7714             :       } else {
    7715             :         check_assertion(left_qualifiers == TQ_NONE);
    7716             :         left_qualifiers = inner_left_qualifiers;
    7717             :       }  /* if */
    7718             :     }  /* if */
    7719             :     /* Return the left qualifiers to the caller if they can't be handled
